For performance reasons were changed the access to loggers, instead of the former common: logger.info("{0}*{0}={1}", 3, 9); we now use the a lot faster syntax (performance-wise) logger.info("{0}*{0}={1}", [3, 9]); to make sure that you have the fastest logging at your finger tips. We will publish within the next days a .swc which allows you to use the api as you are used to for backwards compatibility. To be offer this new backwards compatibility all the .api package was introduced.
For details: Adobe Bug #224
By default the logging framework does not render statements to trace anymore. This has been made to ensure that at deploy-time the logging consumes as few resources as necessary.
The former deprecated LoggerFactory.getNamedLogger and LoggerFactory.getLogger have been dumped to enforce our police of not keeping legacy code for too long.
The former suggested way of requesting a logger via LoggerFactory.getNamedLogger was deprecated in favor of getLogger
